title: Predictive Availability
description: Calculate the probability of bed availability on a specific future day given current high utilization. Useful for weekend staffing planning based on mid-week census.
sql_template:
WITH daily_stats AS (
  SELECT 
    CAST(Midnight_Census_DateTime AS DATE) as census_date, 
    dayofweek(Midnight_Census_DateTime) as dow_idx, 
    COUNT(*) as current_census
  FROM synthetic_hospital_data
  WHERE Location LIKE '%{{target_ward}}%'
  GROUP BY 1, 2
),
scenarios AS (
  SELECT 
    t1.census_date as condition_date,
    t1.current_census as condition_load,
    t2.current_census as outcome_load,
    ({{capacity}} - t2.current_census) as outcome_available
  FROM daily_stats t1
  JOIN daily_stats t2 ON t2.census_date = t1.census_date + INTERVAL {{days_gap}} DAY
  WHERE t1.dow_idx = {{start_dow}} -- Filter for condition day (e.g. Thursday = 4)
)
SELECT 
  COALESCE(
    (COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE outcome_available >= {{target_beds}}) * 100.0 / NULLIF(COUNT(*), 0)), 
    0
  ) as probability_pct,
  COUNT(*) as sample_size
FROM scenarios
WHERE (condition_load::FLOAT / {{capacity}}) > {{util_threshold}};

title: Bottleneck Analysis
description: Identify specific hours where clinical services experience higher admission volumes than discharges, creating patient flow backlogs.
sql_template:
WITH hourly_admits AS (
  SELECT 
    Clinical_Service, 
    hour(Admit_DT) as hr, 
    count(*) as admit_vol
  FROM synthetic_hospital_data
  WHERE Clinical_Service IS NOT NULL AND Admit_DT IS NOT NULL
  GROUP BY 1, 2
),
hourly_discharges AS (
  SELECT 
    Clinical_Service, 
    hour(Discharge_DT) as hr, 
    count(*) as discharge_vol
  FROM synthetic_hospital_data
  WHERE Clinical_Service IS NOT NULL AND Discharge_DT IS NOT NULL
  GROUP BY 1, 2
)
SELECT 
  COALESCE(a.Clinical_Service, d.Clinical_Service) as service,
  COALESCE(a.hr, d.hr) as hour_of_day,
  COALESCE(a.admit_vol, 0) as admits,
  COALESCE(d.discharge_vol, 0) as discharges,
  (COALESCE(a.admit_vol, 0) - COALESCE(d.discharge_vol, 0)) as net_bottleneck
FROM hourly_admits a
FULL OUTER JOIN hourly_discharges d 
  ON a.Clinical_Service = d.Clinical_Service 
  AND a.hr = d.hr
WHERE (COALESCE(a.admit_vol, 0) - COALESCE(d.discharge_vol, 0)) > {{min_threshold}}
ORDER BY net_bottleneck DESC, service, hour_of_day;

title: Day-of-Week Volatility
description: Rank units by the standard deviation of their daily census counts to identify the most unpredictable staffing environments.
sql_template:
WITH daily_counts AS (
  SELECT 
    CAST(Midnight_Census_DateTime AS DATE) as census_date,
    Location,
    COUNT(*) as census
  FROM synthetic_hospital_data
  GROUP BY 1, 2
)
SELECT 
  Location,
  ROUND(AVG(census), 1) as avg_census,
  ROUND(STDDEV(census), 2) as census_std_dev,
  -- Coefficient of Variation (Relative Volatility)
  ROUND((STDDEV(census) / NULLIF(AVG(census), 0)) * 100, 1) as volatility_index
FROM daily_counts
GROUP BY 1
HAVING AVG(census) >= {{min_avg_census}}
ORDER BY census_std_dev DESC
LIMIT 20;

title: Utilization Spikes
description: Find all 3-day consecutive windows where unit utilization exceeded 100% of capacity (assumed 20 beds).
sql_template:
WITH daily_util AS (
  SELECT 
    CAST(Midnight_Census_DateTime as DATE) as dt,
    Location,
    COUNT(*) / 20.0 as util_rate
  FROM synthetic_hospital_data
  WHERE Location = '{{unit_name}}'
  GROUP BY 1, 2
),
windows AS (
  SELECT 
    dt,
    util_rate,
    LEAD(util_rate, 1) OVER (ORDER BY dt) as next_day,
    LEAD(util_rate, 2) OVER (ORDER BY dt) as next_next_day
  FROM daily_util
)
SELECT 
  dt as spike_start_date,
  util_rate as day_1_util,
  next_day as day_2_util,
  next_next_day as day_3_util
FROM windows
WHERE util_rate > 1.0 AND next_day > 1.0 AND next_next_day > 1.0
ORDER BY dt DESC;

title: Seasonal Growth
description: Month-over-Month percentage census growth to determine seasonal staffing needs.
sql_template:
WITH monthly_counts AS (
  SELECT 
    date_trunc('month', Midnight_Census_DateTime) as mth,
    Clinical_Service,
    count(*) as census
  FROM synthetic_hospital_data
  WHERE Clinical_Service IN ('{{service_a}}', '{{service_b}}')
  GROUP BY 1, 2
)
SELECT 
  mth,
  Clinical_Service,
  census,
  LAG(census) OVER (PARTITION BY Clinical_Service ORDER BY mth) as prev_month,
  ((census - LAG(census) OVER (PARTITION BY Clinical_Service ORDER BY mth)) / NULLIF(LAG(census) OVER (PARTITION BY Clinical_Service ORDER BY mth), 0)::FLOAT) * 100 as mom_growth_pct
FROM monthly_counts
ORDER BY mth DESC, Clinical_Service;

title: Bed Turnover Time
description: Average time (minutes) between one patient's Discharge and the next patient's Admit in the same unit.
sql_template:
WITH unit_flow AS (
  SELECT 
    Location,
    Discharge_DT,
    LEAD(Admit_DT) OVER (PARTITION BY Location ORDER BY Admit_DT) as next_admit
  FROM synthetic_hospital_data
  WHERE Location = '{{unit_name}}'
)
SELECT 
  AVG(date_diff('minute', Discharge_DT, next_admit)) as avg_turnover_minutes
FROM unit_flow
WHERE next_admit > Discharge_DT -- Ensure sequential validity
  AND date_diff('hour', Discharge_DT, next_admit) < 24; -- Filter out long empty spells

title: Conditional Overstay Risk
description: Given a patient has stayed 4 days, probability they stay at least another 3 days.
sql_template:
WITH stays AS (
  SELECT date_diff('day', Admit_DT, Discharge_DT) as los
  FROM synthetic_hospital_data
  WHERE Location LIKE '%{{unit_type}}%'
)
SELECT 
  (COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE los >= 7) * 100.0 / NULLIF(COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE los >= 4), 0)) as conditional_probability
FROM stays;

title: Maternity-Nursery Link
description: Correlation between Maternity Ward census and Nursery Census (synchronization pressure).
sql_template:
WITH mat AS (
  SELECT CAST(Midnight_Census_DateTime as DATE) as dt, count(*) as cnt 
  FROM synthetic_hospital_data WHERE Location = '{{maternity_unit}}' GROUP BY 1
),
nur AS (
  SELECT CAST(Midnight_Census_DateTime as DATE) as dt, count(*) as cnt 
  FROM synthetic_hospital_data WHERE Location = '{{nursery_unit}}' GROUP BY 1
)
SELECT 
  corr(mat.cnt, nur.cnt) as correlation_coefficient
FROM mat 
JOIN nur ON mat.dt = nur.dt;
